intro: Mastigion rothschildianum, commonly known as the Rothschild's mastic tree, is a rare and ancient species native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its thick, aromatic bark and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by fragrant, resinous fruits. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to its limited distribution and habitat degradation, it is considered endangered.
